instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage around SMC 0.02A died after UC
threads.message:
Seems all the drama happened around the SMC
[ATTACH type="full" alt="1700461174051.png"]61350[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full" alt="1700461300258.png"]61351[/ATTACH]

Corroded track on  <RESISTOR>R5193</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5117</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5177</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> replaced and rewired broken joints
<CHIP>U3710</CHIP> had a bad track to <SIGNAL>SMC_OOB</SIGNAL> line, rewired that

After all this was repaired, it turned on and seemed ok, so I ran it over Ultrasonic Cleaner, then 0.02A and dead. maybe a cold joint occurred, so I went and reballed the SMC thinking it might have corroded underneath. But no liquid residue underneath. 

Checked the continuity on all these corroded tracks. I am missing something, but not sure what. What is the best way to approach it?

[ATTACH type="full" width="561px" alt="1700461664237.png"]61352[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage around SMC 0.02A died after UC
threads.message:
Don't use ultrasonic cleaner, when the corrosion is located on a small area.

Now check basic signals and voltages from power on sequence.
What is exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage (without battery)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage around SMC 0.02A died after UC
threads.message:
Just tried this morning and it turned on, I will test furthermore. 

I have UC'd only the SMC area, just to make sure corrosion is not underneath. 
Thanks again,
